abstract: Lawmakers in Beijing are about to pass legislation limiting foreign acquisitions in China on national security grounds.
snippet: Lawmakers in Beijing are about to pass legislation limiting foreign acquisitions in China on national security grounds.
lead_paragraph: HONG KONG, Aug. 27  As the Chinese government and many Chinese companies start looking for foreign companies to buy, including a possible bid for a United States manufacturer of computer hard drives, lawmakers in Beijing are about to pass legislation limiting foreign acquisitions in China on national security grounds.

headline.main: China to Step Up Scrutiny of Buyouts
